text: Jill N. Tokuda is a former Democratic member of the Hawaii Senate, representing the 24th District (Kailua-Kaneohe) from 2006 to 2018. ==Education== Tokuda earned her BA in international relations with a minor in Japanese studies from George Washington University. ==Elections== * 2018 Tokuda chose not to run for reelection to become a candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Hawaii. In the August 11, 2018 Democratic primary, Tokuda lost the party nomination to Josh Green. * 2014 Tokuda was unopposed for the August 9, 2014 Democratic primary. She won the November 4, 2014 General election with 13,817 votes (70,8%) against Republican candidate Kilomana Michael Danner. * 2010 Tokuda was unopposed for the September 18, 2010 Democratic primary. She won the November 2, 2010 General election with 10,010 votes (56.4%) against Republican candidate Tracy Nakano Bean. * 2006 Tokuda was unopposed for the September 23, 2006 Democratic primary. She won the November 7, 2006 General election with 9,429 votes (55.6%) against Republican candidate Keoki Leong. ==Recent career== In 2019, Tokuda was named as the executive director for the Nisei Veterans Memorial Center on Maui. ==References== ==External links== *- Senator Jill N. Tokuda *Project Vote Smart - Senator Jill N. Tokuda (HI) profile *Follow the Money - Jill N. title: Jill Tokuda
